data.title: Beautiful view of the river, but the rooms are 'tired' at best
data.text:
The staff was courteous and friendly, but the room we had (4th floor) was more than a disappointment.  As soon as we walked off the elevator, the stains and gum on the hallway carpet gave us a hint of what we would find in the room.  The carpeting looked like it had been installed with carelessness - 30-40 'humps' and folds, the desk and chair were worn out, and the lack of available electric outlets left us hunting for a place to recharge our phones.  The bed was nice, but the pillows were only the bouncy foam type that left my neck stiff and sore the next day.  When I told the desk clerk at checkout about the obvious need for renovation, he seemed surprised at the floor and room conditions. 

Our reservations were originally for 4 days, but we checked out of the Riverview after the first night and moved over to the Hampton Inn (rated #1 on TripAdvisor). What a contrast!  I was blown away by the quality of the accommodations at the Hampton, and all for $25 more per night.  

I wanted to try the Riverview, but I regret a wasted night there.

data.title: Good Mid-Range Hotel in Great Location
data.text: I felt like I got what I expected...this hotel advertises itself as a nice mid-range property with a great downtown location. Other hotels in the area were out a little farther closer to more retail, but the three of us couples were in town to see a show at the Roxy, so this was perfect for our needs. It was a quick walk to the theatre and a delicious dinner at Edward's. We also took advantage of the beautiful fall day to use the Riverwalk right outside the door, which highlights the Cumberland River. I will admit that the outside of the hotel gave me a little pause when we pulled up, but the lobby and our room were a pleasantly updated surprise. The staff was helpful, and there was free breakfast & a pool, which we didn't take advantage of. Our room was on the executive level (and I would recommend calling and requesting that because I understand they are in the middle of renovations and these rooms are finished.) As per other reviewers, the windows in our room needed to be replaced because they were "foggy", but our view was of the parking lot anyway, so no big deal for our short stay. They "roll up the streets" downtown early, even on a weekend, so if you are looking for nightlife, you might consider a different location. Overall, very happy with our choice for this trip.

data.title: Consistent and Clean
data.text: Have stayed there twice in the past year.  The front desk staff were helpful and friendly--especially Bruce he is a charmer!  The property is well maintained, well decorated (especially for the holidays), rooms are clean and updated.  Complimentary breakfast is good.  We were there during Halloween Festivities and the hotel handled the parking situation very well.  We will be back!

data.title: Great Reunion
data.text: The staff made check-in super easy. Everybody went out of the way to meet every request. Our room on the 7th floor was far nicer than we were expecting. Fantastic view of the river and walkover from the hotel to the river walk.

owner_response.author: lcapps, Guest Services at Riverview Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Mr. Robert! Thanks a bunch for taking the time to write a review for us! I feel we have a great team of employees here and it makes my heart happy to have you give recognition to them for trying their best. :) Thanks very much and we hope to have you stay with us again! -Christy, Guest Services
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Perfect
data.text: I am a big Monkees fan, so we visited Clarksville for that reason. But the hotel stay was fantastic and the view of the Cumberland River spectacular. We got lost and the new gentleman at the desk stayed on the phone with me until I got to the hotel. (Take note, the name of the highway to this hotel changes many times, just stay on it and keep driving).

owner_response.author: lcapps, Guest Services at Riverview Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much for this lovely review and for singling out our dear front desk clerk Miles! (:  We appreciate you taking the time to give us some feedback on your stay, and we're so glad it was good enough to write about! Thanks a bunch! -Christy, Guest Services
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Customer Service is not good
data.text: We stayed at this hotel during a Bands of  America marching competition. Upon check in I give the gentleman behind the desk my credit card. He swiped it and told me it swiped. He then proceeds to make a copy of my card because it doesn't have raised numbers . I questioned him about this. The next morning I visit the desk to inquire about this policy again. I'm told they make copies of all the quests cards. I have been in retail for 29+ years. If a card of any type swiped you don't need a copy of it. The company IWork for wont accept cards without raised numbers if they don't swipe. They made a copy of my card on the Copy Machine . I will be canceling my card when I get home. In this day where there is so much cc fraud how does a hotel get away with doing this??? They had no good answer for me. I will never stay at a Riverview Inn again.

owner_response.author: lcapps, Guest Relations Manager at Riverview Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I am so sorry for this misunderstanding! It is standard procedure that we take copies of cards which do not have raised numbers. When the numbers are raised, we take an imprint of the card. This happens if you stay at a hotel or you rent a car, and is not the same case as it is in retail stores. In our case, it is for incidentals-- i.e., damage is caused to the room and the cost of which is greater than what your card was initially authorized for. Additionally, it proves that the card was physically here in our possession. This prevents identity theft and protects both our and your rights.
I understand your fear that your credit card information may be stolen because we have it, however, I assure you that we take all steps possible to keep it secure. The employees which work behind the front counter are all deemed trustworthy by management and are subject to background checks prior to hiring, and the imprinted registration cards are kept secure. If you would like, feel free to call your bank and discuss it with them. Again, so sorry for any stress this may have caused you and I am happy to hear that beyond this, your stay was pleasant. Thanks for voicing your concern! -Christy, Guest Services
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice Stay
data.text: I booked this hotel because of the price, last minute trip to Clarksville and this hotel was the cheapest and closest to where I was going to spend most of my time.  I have to say overall it was a nice stay.  The hotel could use a renovation the furnishings were dated however I have to say it was clean and the bed was VERY comfortable,  Water pressure in the shower was amazing only if you like intense water pressure.  The common areas were clean and the customer service was great.

data.title: wonderful stay
data.text:
We arrived early and were able to check in early. Our room was just fine! Hospitality was wonderful and they had everything you need! Great breakfast selection and breakfast to go if you check out our are on the run! 
OUTSIDE LOOKS ROUGH - BUT GREAT INSIDE!
Gray location to food and spirits!

Staying again in September!

owner_response.author: lcapps, Manager at Riverview Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your kind words Ms. Renee! We have made a few improvements to our breakfast, and it's great that it is being appreciated. I believe we have the friendliest and most hospitable staff around, and am glad that you had a great stay with us. 

We look forward to seeing you sometime this September!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: This place is a dump
data.text: Spent the last 6 days here for the AAU National Championships. Pool was closed for 3 days due to a grate malfunction and someone vomiting on the deck. Staff said maintenance doesn't work on the weekend so pool was closed most of Saturday and all day Sunday. Carpeting in halls are stained beyond cleaning. Windows are fogged due to condensation. Rooms smell like mold. Housekeeping has no idea how to clean a room. 2 of our girls got sick on the powdered eggs, but hey they were free. This place is a dump and should be condemend. Desiree, the hotel bartender was great, and the lobby looks good. Go stay somewhere else.

owner_response.author: lcapps, Manager at Riverview Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I'm very sorry you did not enjoy your stay with us. We agree with you in terms of areas such as the carpeting and windows, are in need of an update & we are making great progress in doing so. The issues with the pool were inconvenient for both parties and I apologize it was closed during part of your stay. It has since been serviced & is back to normal. We couldn't agree more about Desiree, she's wonderful! Thank you for your honesty, and again, I'm very sorry this stay did not meet your expectations!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Outstanding reunion
data.text: Best reunion ever of the 1/26 Blue Spaders. The hotel staff was prepared and ever one staff and employees were so friendly and helpful. The hotel was very clean, the breakfast was great...Thank you..I'll be back.

owner_response.author: lcapps, Manager at Riverview Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for the kind words, Joe!! I'm so glad to hear this was the best reunion yet!! We very much enjoyed having you all...such a wonderful group of men & women!! We hope you come back and see us again soon & thank you for your service! Take care!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best complimentary breakfast ever.
data.text: We went to visit our son and family, the hotel was a real treat.  the complimentary breakfast was a real eye opener.  Fresh eggs, bacon or sausage, biscuits, waffles made on the spot, fresh fruit, juice, yogurt, coffee, tea.  Staff was very welcoming and caring, especially the breakfast hostess.

owner_response.author: lcapps, Manager at Riverview Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you, Lila, for taking the time to write such a kind review! I'm glad you enjoyed the hot breakfast & all it has to offer!! We are very fortunate to have such a kind, welcoming staff! Please give us a call when you're back in the area- we'd love to have you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Another great stay!
data.text: I returned to this location having had a wonderful stay there two years ago.  I booked the room months in advance (the Cumberland Suite).  Upon arrival, I discovered that someone (no longer employed there!) had booked a room with one queen bed instead of the suite requested.  Thanks to Damien, now referred to by my family as the Miracle Worker, he not only put us in the room we had requested, but made an adjustment to make up for the shock of entering a misbooked room that could in no way accommodate 4 people.  I can't begin to describe his determination to make amends, especially considering the pressures of having a full house for the night. Sandra was equally responsive during check-out.  The hotel was perfect in cleanliness, comfort, amenities, and staff.  The Cumberland Suite is unbeatable for comfort and spaciousness and the river view is mesmerizing.  It will continue to be our home away from home when we visit Clarksville.  Damien, our heartfelt thanks for saving our 2-night vacation/class reunion.

owner_response.author: lcapps, Manager at Riverview Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to write such a great review!! I'm very sorry about the mix up with your requested room type, but am pleased to hear your were accommodated so well by Damien and Sandra. They are both exceptional employees and we're very proud to have them on our team! I love that you use the term "home away from home". That's exactly how we want our guests to feel- right at home. I'm so glad you had a comfortable and enjoyable stay! Thank you for your continued support and we're looking forward to seeing you again soon!!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great view, comfortable, clean, old.
data.text: Centrally located, beautiful view of the river at no extra charge. Upon check-in, front desk was delightful & very helpful. Nice to see a smiling face after driving for awhile. Hot Breakfast included with a wide selection, scrambled eggs, waffles, oatmeal, grits, bagels, fruits, juices, coffee, etc. Rooms are quiet, cool, comfortable, a little small, clean, and out dated. I would give it an excellent if it was not for two things. Check-out lady was not friendly, she was not rude, " just doing my job" attitude. My other complaint was that hotel guest were hanging out by the entrance & smoking. We had to walk through a cloud of smoke to enter. The hotel needs to address this issue and enforce a designated smoking area away from the entrance. We would definitely stay here again. If you go for a college visit there is a special rate.

owner_response.author: lcapps, Manager at Riverview Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the kind words and honest review!! I'm very pleased to hear you were greeted with a smile upon arrival, and that you enjoyed the hot breakfast!! I apologize for the issue regarding the smokers lingering by the entrance. Several changes are taking place to ensure this is isn't an issue in the future. I'm glad you were about to take advantage of that special rate!! Thank you for your business and we hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice facility, friendly desk staff, great location
data.text: Very nice accommodations near the river & convenient to Austin Peay State University. Front desk staff was very friendly & helpful. Breakfast foods are not four star, but still good. Beds are very comfortable & rooms have microwave & mini fridges. Local market in a nearby parking lot on Saturday mornings.

owner_response.author: lcapps, Manager at Riverview Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the kind words!! I'm glad you enjoyed your stay, as well as the Farmers Market and convenience to APSU! We're very fortunate to be in such a wonderful location! We appreciate your business and hope you come back and see us again soon!! Take care!!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fair priced
data.text: This hotel was fairly priced, normally in the $100ish range per night, but I was able to get it for around $7 on Orbits. The rooms are clean and do not have, showers are a bit odd to use but work well. Free WiFi available as well and plenty of parking if pulling a trailer.

data.title: Great location and service
data.text: Clarksville is hometown and when we go home we always choose the Riverview Inn. We love the downtown location, restaurants, and walks along the river. We keep coming back because of the excellent service.

owner_response.author: lcapps, Manager at Riverview Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the kind words, Ron! We're so happy to hear you choose to stay with us every time you return home! We couldn't agree more about the location- we're very fortunate to have so many wonderful restaurants and attractions within a walking distance! So glad to hear the service met your expectations as well! We're looking forward to your next visit! Take care!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: No "river view" but ...
data.text: ... a nice older hotel that has an elegance missing from newer places.  The room was comfy - had Keurig coffee-maker and lovely dark wood furniture. The windows don't open & the a/c unit didn't cool well (froze up quickly).  A pretty good breakfast nook ...we all are trying to eat healthier & fresh fruit & other items should be added.  Staff was friendly & attentive.  If you get placed on the 7th floor, the elevator needs a code that DOES NOT WORK on elevator #2 - FYI.

owner_response.author: lcapps, Manager at Riverview Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your honest Review! We're pleased to hear your kind words regarding our staff and room amenities! I apologize for the AC trouble and hope our maintenance staff were able to take care of the issue quickly! I appreciate your suggestion in regards to healthier breakfast options, and we are excited to say we are making improvements left and right! As for the second elevator, we haven't experienced an issue with it ourselves, but that code can be a bit tricky! Our front desk staff would be more than happy to make sure you get up there in the future! Thank you again & we hope to see you soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Spring quarterly meeting
data.text: Excellent accommodations at very reasonable price. They provided great service in all areas. We had two evening meals that were provided by our contract. The service was friendly and quick. The food was excellent. He bed was very comfortable with a clean room. The tub shower was the only complaint as it is somewhat small. Courtney at the front desk was very helpful and always courteous. I will recommend them and go back.

owner_response.author: lcapps, Manager at Riverview Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your kind words!! I'm so glad our staff was able to accommodate you in all areas and that you enjoyed your stay!! Courtney is wonderful and we're very grateful to have her as part of our team! We hope to see you again soon!! Take care!!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dated
data.text: Stayed at this hotel for a softball tournament for my daughter. The hotel is very close to the river walk, which is nice. The hotel itself is dated in terms of wallpaper, curtains, bathrooms, but the beds are comfortable, there is a nice lobby, indoor pool, free breakfast and free parking. We had a room right by the elevator so that was a little noisy

owner_response.author: lcapps, Manager at Riverview Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your honest review, Andi, and for the kind words about the lobby and comfortable beds!! I'm glad you enjoyed the river walk! We love having the luxury of being a walk away from the Cumberland River and McGregor Park. For your next visit, I would recommend reserving an Executive Level room, as we have completed the renovation process on this level. Everything is brand new, top to bottom! It's also a secured floor, so it cuts down tremendously on elevator noise. Thank you again & we hope to see you again soon! Take care!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Clarksville
data.text: Fiancé and I took a nostalgic trip to Clarksville since we originally met here years and years ago. Location was great. Walking distance to bars/restaurants downtown. Staff was nice. Breakfast was decent. Room was nice except there is so much condensation between the window panes that the Riverview is almost nonexistent. Kind of bummed that we paid extra for the executive level but can hardly even see out the window.

owner_response.author: lcapps, Manager at Riverview Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your honest review, Kelly! We hope you and your fiancé had a great time reminiscing & love that you chose to stay with us while in Clarksville! We're so fortunate to be in the heart of downtown! Our deepest apologies that your view was obstructed! We're pleased to say remodeling is currently under way, and we're gradually replacing windows & continuously upgrading as budget allows! We hope you and your fiancé get the chance to stay with us again soon! 
Thanks again, Kelly & take care!!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
